titleStmt.title: [Photograph of water screening to recover artifacts from excavations] / [by Jefferson Chapman]: a machine-readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Chapman, Jefferson

availability.p: This work is the property of the McClung Museum, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Photograph of water screening to recover artifacts from excavations] / [by Jefferson Chapman]
bibl.author: Chapman, Jefferson
bibl.note: This is a photograph of a water screen used to recover archaeological artifacts from 18th century Overhill Cherokee villages in East Tennessee. Excavations were conducted by the University of Tennessee from 1967-1982 as part of the Tellico Archaeological Project in anticipation of the flooding of the lower Little Tennessee River Valley by the Tellico Dam Reservoir. The excavations were conducted under contract with the National Park Service and the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA).
Frank H. McClung Museum Photographic Collection

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

figure.figDesc: Water screening to recover artifacts from excavations. University of Tennessee, 1967-1982. Photograph by Jefferson Chapman. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.

p.note: This document consists of one image only.
